(34588, 37599).name: DGVMs

(34588, 37599).name: GCP
(34588, 37599).label: project

(34588, 37599).name: photosynthesis

(34588, 37599).name: root biomass carbon

(34588, 37599).name: land-use change

(39757, 42705).name: deforestation

(39757, 42705).name: LUH2

(39757, 42705).name: tropics

(39757, 42705).name: DGVMs

(44703, 47460).name: ORCHIDEE

(44703, 47460).description: A dynamic global vegetation model used to simulate the carbon cycle and terrestrial ecosystems>

(44703, 47460).name: forest biomass
(44703, 47460).label: variable

(44703, 47460).name: forest types
(44703, 47460).label: variable
(44703, 47460).description: Different categories of forests, such as tropical, temperate, or boreal, each with unique characteristics and carbon dynamics>

(44703, 47460).name: global environmental changes
(44703, 47460).label: natural hazard

(44703, 47460).name: carbon emissions
(44703, 47460).label: variable

(44703, 47460).name: carbon sinks
(44703, 47460).label: variable

(44703, 47460).name: atmosphere
(44703, 47460).label: location
(44703, 47460).description: The layer of gases surrounding the Earth, where carbon dioxide and other greenhouse gases play a crucial role in regulating climate>

(44703, 47460).name: ocean
(44703, 47460).label: location
(44703, 47460).description: The vast body of saltwater that covers most of the Earth's surface, playing a critical role in the global carbon cycle>

(44703, 47460).name: tropical land
(44703, 47460).label: location
(44703, 47460).description: Regions near the equator, characterized by high temperatures and high levels of biodiversity, where land-use changes can significantly impact carbon cycles>

(44703, 47460).name: temperature variation
(44703, 47460).label: variable
(44703, 47460).description: Changes in temperature over time, which can influence carbon fluxes and ecosystem processes>

(44703, 47460).name: net biome production
(44703, 47460).label: variable
(44703, 47460).description: The net amount of carbon absorbed or released by an ecosystem, calculated as the difference between net primary production and heterotrophic respiration>

(44703, 47460).name: heterotrophic respiration
(44703, 47460).label: variable
(44703, 47460).description: The process by which microorganisms break down organic matter and release carbon into the atmosphere>

(44703, 47460).name: fire CO2 emissions

(44703, 47460).name: grassland
(44703, 47460).label: location
(44703, 47460).description: Ecosystems dominated by grasses and other herbaceous plants, which can play a role in carbon sequestration>

(44703, 47460).name: agricultural lands
(44703, 47460).label: location
(44703, 47460).description: Areas used for farming, grazing, or other agricultural purposes, which can be significant sources of carbon emissions>
